thread.title: Florida Atlantic: Injured FAU backfield could lead to more opportunity for Trey Rodriguez
thread.title_full: Florida Atlantic: Injured FAU backfield could lead to more opportunity for Trey Rodriguez - Sun Sentinel

author: Shandel Richardson
title: Florida Atlantic: Injured FAU backfield could lead to more opportunity for Trey Rodriguez
text:
With No. 2 running back Jay Warren still dealing with injury, Florida Atlantic freshman Trey Rodriguez could be a bigger part of the offense this week.
Warren is experiencing problems from a rib injury sustained the second game of the season against Miami, leaving opportunity for Rodriguez.
"We're not down on Jay," Partridge said. "It's really a health issue for Jay. We want to get Jay as close [to being healthy] as we can. We need Jay, and that's the conversation I had with him."
Rodriguez made his debut last week after missing the first four games because of suspension for violating team rules. He accounted for 57 total yards and a touchdown against Rice.
"He's been on scout team for four weeks," Partridge said. "We feel comfortable with him executing."
Partridge said he was most impressed with Rodriguez's ability to avoid tackles. He will likely serve as the backup to starter Buddy Howell against Marshall.
"He's able to deny people from getting clean tackles on him," Rodriguez said. "He gets a guy out of positon and he has the power to run through arm tackles â€¦ He's got good hands. He's catches the ball well out of the backfield."
QB also recovering
Add quarterback Jaquez Johnson to list of players battling nagging injuries. Partridge said Johnson continues to deal with an ankle injury sustained in the Miami game.
Johnson is listed as day-to-day but expected to play against Marshall.
"We'll just see where [Johnson] is day by day," Partridge said. "Obviously there's wear and tear that goes in the course of the game so we'll see how he recovers over the next couple of days."
Next game: FAU vs. Marshall, Noon, Saturday, Fox College Sports.
srichardson@tribpub.com
